How to Run MOF2BEAN on Unix

Last Updated 09/26/03

mof2bean is a script that generates JavaBeans™ that represent the CIM classes defined in a MOF file. mof2bean also needs a Bean configuration file that defines any desired package names, import statements and exceptions that you might want in the generated JavaBean.

WARNING: The MOF file should include any Qualifier definitions that its class definitions require. See Simple.mof

WARNING: The Bean configuration file should not contain any blank lines. See bean.txt

  • Go to the directory containing the WBEM Services executables.
    • If you built the WBEM Services executables in /files/open, go to directory /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin.
    • If you downloaded or copied the WBEM Services executables into /wbemservices, go to directory /wbemservices/bin
  • Run sh mof2bean.sh. You will see the following: 
     wbem% cd /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin
 wbem% sh mof2bean.sh 
Usage: sh mof2bean.sh user passwd bean_config mof_file
 wbem% sh mof2bean.sh root root_passwd /files/open/dist/wbemservices/doc/bean.txt /files/open/dist/wbemservices/doc/Simple.mof
*********************************************************
Generating JavaBeans from /files/open/dist/wbemservices/doc/Simple.mof in /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/bean
*********************************************************
/usr/java/bin/java -classpath .:/files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/mofcomp.jar:/files/open/dist/wbemservices/cimom/lib/cimom.jar:/files/open/dist/wbemservices/lib/wbem.jar:/files/open/dist/wbemservices/cimom/lib/cimrepository.jar org.wbemservices.wbem.compiler.mofc.CIM_Mofc -u root -p root_passwd -o /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/bean /files/open/dist/wbemservices/doc/bean.txt /files/open/dist/wbemservices/doc/Simple.mof
Compilation succeeded.
 wbem% ls bean/*.java
bean/CIMBeanImpl.java            bean/Simple_ClassBeanImpl.java
bean/CIMBean.java                bean/Simple_ClassBean.java
  • The generated .java files will be found in the subdirectory bean; e.g. /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/bean or /files/wbemservices/bean. Here, the generated files are CIMBeanImpl.java, CIMBean.java, Simple_ClassBeanImpl.java, and Simple_ClassBean.java. CIMBean.java defines the base Java interface while CIMBeanImpl.java represents the base bean that implements this interface. Likewise, Simple_ClassBean.java defines the inteface for the Simple_Class as defined in Simple.mof while Simple_ClassBeanImpl.java represents the bean that implements this interface.
